sentences.en: "You can tell that he is extremely embarrassed," Mr Brigden added.
sentences.cn: “你能看出他尴尬极了，”布里格登先生补充道。
阿诺德感到有点儿尴尬。

sentences.en: Candida admits to having been "mortally embarrassed".
sentences.cn: 坎迪达承认当时“尴尬得要命”。

sentences.en: Do you think she was embarrassed about it?
sentences.cn: 你觉得她曾为此而难为情吗？

sentences.en: He is embarrassed by the red carpet treatment.
sentences.cn: 走红地毯的礼遇让他感到很局促。

sentences.en: He looked embarrassed when I asked him where he’d been.
sentences.cn: 我问他去了哪里，他显得很窘迫。

sentences.en: Her questions about my private life embarrassed me.
sentences.cn: 她询问我的私生活使我感到很尴尬。

sentences.en: I just went quiet, embarrassed, and couldn't answer.
sentences.cn: 我一下子收了声，红了脸，答不出话来。

sentences.en: I said "Sorry", very feebly, feeling rather embarrassed.
sentences.cn: 我小声说了一句“对不起”，觉得很不好意思。

sentences.en: I think she was hugely embarrassed by the whole scene.
sentences.cn: 我认为整个场面让她极其尴尬。

sentences.en: Lori gets embarrassed if we ask her to sing.
sentences.cn: 我们要是请洛丽唱歌，她就会难为情。

sentences.en: Polly, bewildered and embarrassed, dropped her head and scuffed her feet.
sentences.cn: 波莉既困惑又尴尬，低下头拖着脚走开了。

sentences.en: She was embarrassed at showing her fear so nakedly.
sentences.cn: 她对于如此直接地表露了自己的恐惧感到尴尬不已。

sentences.en: They wolf-whistled at me, and I was so embarrassed I tripped up.
sentences.cn: 他们吹口哨挑逗我，我窘迫之下绊了一跤。

sentences.en: This practice embarrassed Luther, but he let it pass without comment.
sentences.cn: 这种做法让卢瑟难堪，但是他未置一词。

sentences.en: William was angered and embarrassed by his oversight.
sentences.cn: 威廉因为自己的疏忽而羞愤交加。

words.tran_cn: 使人尴尬的；令人为难的
使人尴尬地；令人难堪地
窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
使局促不安；使困窘；阻碍

trans.tran_cn: 局促不安的，为难的，尴尬的，窘迫的
trans.tran_en: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public

trans.tran_cn: （使）窘迫，（使）局促不安( embarrass的过去式和过去分词)
